page.title: 14WEST MAINS
page.content: The A68 is carried over a deep wooded ravine by a bridge constructed by the civil engineer, Thomas Telford. Travellers are not likely to be aware of the bridge as the ravine is tree clad and rises above the road on both sides. There is one large house, with the odd name of Frostineb, with two small cottages nearby, situated on a right-of-way half way between Fala and Saughland farm. Frostineb is now a private residence, but was, a few years ago, the farm house of West Mains farm. The farmland is now rented out to local farmers for the growing of crops and sheep rearing.
